hero.imageAlt: Abstract sound wave visualization representing music licensing

intro.paragraph1: Playing music in a business is different from listening at home. When you use music commercially, you need permission from the rights holders who created that music.
intro.paragraph2Intro: To legally play music in your business, you need

types.sectionSubtitle: Each license protects different rights holders and ensures fair compensation

recording.name: Recording License
recording.description: Covers the right to use a specific recording of a song and compensates the recording artist.

publishing.name: Publishing License
publishing.description: Covers the right to use the original composition and compensates the songwriters and composers.

performance.name: Public Performance License
performance.description: Allows you to play the song in a public environment like your business venue.

warning.personalUseOnly: These services are licensed for personal use only.
warning.liability: Using them in a commercial setting violates their terms of service and can expose your business to legal liability.
